website_summaries.verdict: High price point, but produces photographs and video of amazing quality.
pros: Mirrorless design of X-T2 produces image quality and performance levels similar to a DSLR camera but in a smaller camera body
Includes a viewfinder for framing photos
cons: You'll have to purchase lenses separately

customer_reviews.title: Buy it for the shooting experience. Pictures are excellent too.
customer_reviews.text: Above all else, this camera is just fun to use because of its manual controls, but there's so much more to it than that. High ISO performance is very impressive. Fujifilm's lens collection is well rounded and they're all sharp with quality second to none. Weather sealing gives you good peace of mind when you're at the campground and everyone's kicking up dust or you want to take photos of puddles in the rain. The big, bright EVF is great for previewing what your shot will actually look like. The camera feels good in your hands, with a grip that's really good but not as deep and sure as a DSLR's but that's ok. Overall, I love this bad boy.
customer_reviews.author: robert

customer_reviews.title: Good Camera but...
customer_reviews.text: I got the XT2 because I needed another body for my photography. I decided to get it over the XT1 (which I already have) because of the better weather resistance and 24mp sensor. The first few times I used the camera, it worked well, but then I started to get a major problem - the shutter button started to stick. I couldn't understand why because my XT1 had been used more and in worse conditions than the XT2. This is a major fault with the camera and it seems I'll have to take it back to Fuji to fix. If I were to choose again - I'd purchase the XT1 instead.
customer_reviews.author: D. Carpenay

customer_reviews.title: It is not a camera, it is a computerwith a lens attached to it.
customer_reviews.text: I went over the reviews and it seems like this camera in excellent, once you can figure out how to make it work. Unfortunately although I am a very experienced film photographer, my experience with digital cameras is limited. I specifically purchased this camera on the assumption that the manual knobs that control aperture, speed, ISO sensitivity etc. would allow me the type of manual control I wanted. Unfortunately I was horrified to see that the 350 page manual requires all kinds of settings that I was not prepared for. The camera was rerturned within 24 hours of receipt because it no meet my expectations.
customer_reviews.author: Faustino L. Prado

customer_reviews.title: Buy it at your own risk!
customer_reviews.text: I made the mistake to buy the Fuji XT-2 as my first mirrorless camera to team up with my $15.000 life investment on Canon equipment. After a few days of use and a couple of jobs done with the XT-2 I realize that now is the perfect time to sell all my Canon gear before people start noticing how superior Fujifilm is to Canon. Seriously, it is a game changer...
customer_reviews.author: egmancera

customer_reviews.title: I love my Fuji XT2 Camera!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this a year ago and wanted to use it appropriately before reviewing it. I have been a Nikon user for 15 year and then went to Canon for the last 25. I wanted to just see what this camera could do, not really expecting a whole lot, and I don't know why because every review and video I watched on this was excellent without any (or noticeable flaws) and it has not disappointed me in the least. I love this camera and haven't complained a bit buying bit of Fuji glass to go with it. Very, very pleased.
customer_reviews.author: The Quintessential Man

customer_reviews.title: Best decision ever.
customer_reviews.text: I have been a Nikon shooter for almost 8 years, but I decided to switch to Fujifilm because of the weight difference and EVF. After using the camera for a month I can say I don't miss using Nikon at all. The Fuji system has very sharp lens and the colors are amazing. If you don't believe me jist look up any of the review of any lens on Amazon. I was impressed that they ALL have great review. Highly recommended. Go out and buy yourself 1 now.
customer_reviews.author: Z. Wu

customer_reviews.title: A Huge Step Up from my XT1
customer_reviews.text: Bought this used. Great price. Excellent quality. Fabulous physical condition. Love the "Joy Stick" for focus points. Much faster than my XT1 which is also a great camera. Battery life "could be better" - it eats batteries. So have plenty of spares. Other than that no complaints. It's slightly bigger than the XT1 which, even though my hands are small, I prefer. Highly recommended camera. If you can't stretch to a new XT3 (I couldn't) then get a great used XT2. You won't regret it.
customer_reviews.author: R. P. Whiteman

customer_reviews.title: Fuji is fantastic
customer_reviews.text: Love love love this camera. I've been a Nikon user for years but in 2014 I bought an x100s and quickly found myself using it far more than my d700. I've been wanting to make the switch to a full fuji system for years and snagged this on sale. Love it!! The color and clarity are outstanding, the controls are great and it weighs so much less than a dslr. Very excited to use this going forward.
customer_reviews.author: kaeldra1

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't get any better..
customer_reviews.text: Doesn't get any better ... after many decades of shoulder breaking SLR's and DSLR's these mirrorless cameras are amazing and amazingly great. The FujiFilm lenses are terrific. Everything is so much smaller and lighter. Might be TOO Small for someone with really large hands. I always rent first to try out gear ... from lensrentals.com. They make it so easy.

customer_reviews.title: Very happy with my Fuji Mirrorless!
customer_reviews.text: I used to have a Canon 7D and I am very happy now with my Fuji X-T2. I'm having fun again shooting. I love the size of the body and lenses and must of all, the way you can focus. EVF is wonderful. Although I've read that Fujis' focus isn't good in fast action situations, the camera has quite a few adjusts that I have to play around. I also love the quality of Fuji's lenses. I really feel the need to go outside and shoot!!!

customer_reviews.title: Amazing Camera for hobbyists and professional work
customer_reviews.text: This camera simply exceeded all my expectations in my first mirrorless camera. The built quality is superb and weatherproof. When I first got this camera the first thing that I did was to update to 4.0 firmware to get 120fps and flog internal recording and that was simply easy. Learning curve is a bit high but if you like reading the manual and watching YouTube videos for xt2 I guess it would be pretty direct and easy to master it. I’m planning to get the battery grip as this camera is power hungry although I temporarily fixed that by having 3 batteries everytime.

I got my X-T2 used in like new condition for half the price of a new X-T3. 30 day free return, but no reason to return it :) It's much more like shooting a real DSLR than my X-E2S

customer_reviews.title: The camera is utterly amazing and fantastic.

This thing is so much more capable than the XT1 and it's bringing the same sense of joy and fun into photography that I sensed when I purchased my first Fuji, the E2. customer_reviews.title: Solid upgrade.
customer_reviews.text: Coming from an xt1 user... This is a solid upgrade. The xt1 is still a great camera, but the xt2 improves in the following areas. - about a stop better ISO performance - snappier autofocus plus less blackout time equals and overall more responsive shooting experience. - control knobs are slightly taller, allowing easier setting adjustments. Also there are toggle lock buttons in the center of the control knobs. On the xt1 you have to hold the center button to adjust ISO. Not so on the xt2 - feels a little more substantial in the hand. - more resolution. This is something that I noticed immediately. extremely deatailed images.

customer_reviews.title: Just an amazing camera all around

If you're on the fence, do it, I don't think you'll be disappointed.

customer_reviews.title: King of the hill
customer_reviews.text: You've done your homework already. I'm just confirming it--this camera is everything you've researched and more. That being said, there is one flaw that I've found with this camera, the max low light ISO for a decent shot is 1600. Of course the camera can shoot at ISO 12 billion something but for a person who is critical of their images, 1600 is the max. Sure, you can take care of the noise in Photoshop, but I rather be shooting than Photoshopping. Regardless of ISO, this camera is still the cat's meow.

product_meta.title: Fujifilm X-T2 Mirrorless Digital Camera (Body Only)
product_meta.description: Configuration:BaseThe FUJIFILM X-T2 is the ultimate mirrorless digital camera. The X-T2 is a splash-resistant premium interchangeable lens camera with a large OLED electronic viewfinder (EVF). The X-T2 houses the latest generation 24.3MP X-Trans CMOS III with an APS-C sensor with no low-pass filter, boasting the highest performance in the history of X Series. The new X-T2 produces crisp image resolution comparable to that of cameras equipped with larger sensors and higher pixel counts, all in a more compact and classically-designed body. And for the first time, the new FUJIFILM X-T2 now supports 4K video recording that can use each available Film Simulation mode, including ACROS, to easily produce premium-quality footage that is as unique as the photographer behind the viewfinder.
feature_bullets: 24.3MP X Trans CMOS III APS-C sensor reduces moiré and false colors to improve image quality and X Processor Pro engine increases response times, achieves faster AF, lower noise and better color
Dust and moisture resistant body with approximately 63 points of weather sealing; Freeze resistance to 14 Degree Fahrenheit
High precision 0.48 inch, 2.36 million dot OLED viewfinder featuring a magnification of 0.77x and Ultra fast Real Time Viewfinder with a lag time of 0.005sec
Full HD and 4K 3840x2160 30P/25P/24P shooting (Using a card with the UHS Speed Class 3 or higher)
Tempered glass 1.04 million dot high-precision 3 Inches tilting LCD monitor with three directional tilt and shutter type is focal plane shutter
